title: Standard Library Imports
snippet: Import from the BPL standard library
description: The BPL standard library provides essential utilities organized into modules. Import with 'import [items] from "std/module.bpl"'. Key modules include: std/string (String manipulation), std/vec (dynamic arrays), std/map (hash maps), std/option (optional values), std/result (error handling), std/io (input/output), std/fs (file system). Standard library types typically have init() and cleanup() methods for resource management. Using stdlib modules makes code more idiomatic and maintainable than relying solely on extern C functions. This example shows importing and using standard library utilities.
